intro: Cryptophragmium langbianense, commonly known as the Langbian cryptophragmium, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants known for their aromatic properties and often complex inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. Its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its delicate and intricate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
